de.dfki.embots.behaviorbuilder.view
Class Slider3d

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JPanel
                  de.dfki.embots.behaviorbuilder.view.Slider3d
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.event.ChangeListener
public class Slider3d
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements javax.swing.event.ChangeListener

A component (JPanel) featuring 3 sliders allowing for adjusting Tripels. Objects of this class offer their callers a convenient way to read and manipulate the underlying data by asking for (and delivering) "actual" values, so they do not have to care about the internal representation, Slider-wise, that is handled transparently in the background.

See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

Slider3d

public Slider3d(double minVal,
                double maxVal,
                double xVal,
                double yVal,
                double zVal)
Constructs the object "the simple way".

Parameters:
minVal - minimum possible (actual) value for every slider
maxVal - maximum possible (actual) value for every slider
xVal - the initial (actual) value for the X value
yVal - the initial (actual) value for the Y value
zVal - the initial (actual) value for the Z value

Slider3d

public Slider3d(Triple minVal,
                Triple maxVal,
                Triple iniVal)
Constructs the object "the powerful" way.

Parameters:
minVal - the minimum possible (actual) value for each slider, given as a Triple
maxVal - the maximum possible (actual) value for each slider, given as a Triple
iniVal - the initial (actual) value for each of the sliders

Slider3d

public Slider3d(java.lang.String labelX,
                java.lang.String labelY,
                java.lang.String labelZ,
                Triple minVal,
                Triple maxVal,
                Triple iniVal)
Constructs the object "the powerful" way. Also allows labels.

Parameters:
minVal - the minimum possible (actual) value for each slider, given as a Triple
maxVal - the maximum possible (actual) value for each slider, given as a Triple
iniVal - the initial (actual) value for each of the sliders
Method Detail

stateChanged

public void stateChanged(javax.swing.event.ChangeEvent e)
Gets notified when any of the sliders gets changed, and updates the internal (actual) Triple representation according to all 3 sliders. Implements ChangeListener's stateChanged().

Specified by:
stateChanged in interface javax.swing.event.ChangeListener
Parameters:
e - the event received from Swing on slider change

setActualValue

public void setActualValue(Triple t)
Allows for setting the sliders "from the outside", by giving "actual" values, from which the internal representations are computed.

Parameters:
t - the actual Triple value to be set

getActualValue

public Triple getActualValue()
Get the currently set value of the Triple, in "actual" form (the correct value in the range specified in on construction).

Returns:
the Triple in the form you want it to be

addChangeListener

public void addChangeListener(javax.swing.event.ChangeListener l)
Registers a listener at each slider, so that after the change of a slider, this class's getActualValue() can be called. This is actually a bit of a hack; a scalable class would register itself as listener at the controls, and then fire a property change on its own.

Parameters:
l -

setEnabled

public void setEnabled(boolean enabled)
Lets the caller enable or disable all the sliders at once. To be used like JComponent's setEnabled(), which is overridden here.

Overrides:
setEnabled in class javax.swing.JComponent
Parameters:
enabled -
